result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Atty Baltz requests a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 17, 2023 at 03:30 pm.

State will forward the offer.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

03:00 PM Defendant Joseph A Cross in court with attorney Zachary T Wroblewski who appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Wroblewski states they just recieved discovery and requests an adjournment.
The State does not object.
The Court will adjourn.  Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on July 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:23 AM Defendant Joseph A Cross in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests to waive preliminary hearing today. 
Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.
  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files information. 
Defense accepts receipt of the information and waives reading. 
  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed by Atty. Jason Baltz

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is prohibited from accessing any child exploitation material and any other sexually explicit material through the Internet or by any other means.  Defendant prohibited from contacting a minor over the internet or using a website to gather information about a minor. Defendant is prohibited from intentionally deleting any history from any computer or device that accesses the Internet. Defendant prohibited from using any application where the content automatically deletes upon the recipient opening the content. Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
